availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Death's Valley
bibl.orgname: Papers of Walt Whitman (MSS 3829), Clifton Waller Barrett Library of American Literature, Albert H. Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia
bibl.note: Transcribed from our own digital image of original manuscript

notesstmt.note: Verso of manuscript leaf is dated April, 1892 and states the name of the poem and the word "Magazine"; a second copy of the title is written in Whitman's hand

lg2.l: Nay, do not dream designer dark,
Thou hast portray'd or hit thy theme entire;

del.seg: I, who have watch'd by many a death (and haply
soon to know it in myself,)

l.seg: I, hoverer of late by this dark valley, by
its confines, having glimpses of it
Here enter lists with thee claiming amy right
to makelimn a symbol picture too.

lg2.l: For I have seen many wounded soliders die,

l.seg: After perhaps dread suffering—and have seen their
And I have watch'd the death hours of the

lg2.l: The rich with all his nurses and all his doctors,
And then the poor in meagreness and poverty,

l.seg: And I myself for long O Death have breathed

lg2.l: Amid the nearness and the silent thought of thee.
And out of these and thee,
I make a scene a song, brief (not forout offears of thee

l.seg: Nor gloom's ravines, nor bleak, nor dark—for I

lg2.l: Nor celebrate the struggle or contortion, or the hard-tied knot

l.seg: But of the Of the broad blessed light, and perfect air, writhe mead-
ows, rippling tides, and trees and flowers
And the low hum of living breeze—and in the midst,
thee, d, God's beautiful eternalright hand
ThouThee,holiest minister of Heaven—thou thee, envoy, usherer,

lg2.l: Rich, florid, loosener of the stricture: knot called life,

p.note: You can put the name Walt Whitman either at the top or bottom as you prefer
